revision.text:
{{Pisces}}
Pisces is the 4th month of the [[Gaian calendar]]. It contains 28 days (4 weeks) and corresponds to ISO weeks 13–16.
== Overview == ===Etymology=== English ''Pisces'' "fishes" (Latin plural). Japanese: {{ill|魚座|ja|Uo-za}} “fish-constellation.” ===Gaiad themes=== Weeks 13–16 (Days [[Pisces 1]]–[[Pisces 28]]): crises and renewals; watershed ecological shifts culminating in festival alignments.
After the colonization of the land, we have distortions
It is the month of easters and it has [[Cetus]] on [[Pisces 28]] which is the extinction of the dinosaurs
===EVENTS=== * [[Pisces 7]] — Easter Sunday * [[Pisces 14]] — [[:Category:Days_that_Qingming_Festival_falls_on|Qingming]] and Easter Sunday * [[Pisces 21]] — Easter Sunday * [[Pisces 28]] — Easter Sunday
== Gregorian date ranges (±10 years) == {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Gaian Year !! Start Date !! End Date !! revision.text:
[[File:Alo Nine.svg|thumb|The current [[symbol of Alo]]]] {{nihongo|'''Lifeism'''|命之道教|Inochi-no-Michikyō}} is a religion founded in the 21st century by [[Kamidere]].
Its central deity is [[alo]], the emanating cosmos
Its goal is [[agency]] which is a concept related to being able to impose an order on the world. This is a collectivistic goal.
At its core it revolves around delivering the [[Three Fruits]] to everyone, or colloquially getting everyone [[to Omega]].
Agency is delivered to people through three methods: [[Immortality|freeing them from death]], freeing them from the [[nine plagues]], and freeing them from [[Cosmic destruction]].
Universalism is a critical element of Lifeism. The idea of anyone being excluded goes extremely counter to its values, As such Lifeism identifies itself in contrast with traditions which are exclusionary, especially on traits like race, sexual orientation, gender identity, or social class.
As an extention of universalism Lifeism engages in [[syncretism]] with other traditions. However it is not a syncretic tradition in itself, and is fully capable of standing on its own
The only Evolutionist organization currently in existence is the [[Church of Evolution]] run by [[Kamidere|Immanuelle]]
== Name ==
The tradition is referred to by multiple names across languages. Each name emphasizes different nuances such as linguistic register, cultural resonance, scope, or formality. None of the names is intended as a complete doctrinal statement; rather, they function as labels suited to different contexts.
=== Evolutionism === '''Evolutionism''' is an English term historically used in Christian apologetics—particularly within Evangelical Christianity—to describe acceptance of biological evolution as though it constituted a competing belief system or religion.<ref name="Dichotomy">{{cite web|url=http://ncse.com/cej/4/2/supposed-dichotomy-between-creationism-evolution|title=The Supposed Dichotomy between Creationism and Evolution|author=Gough, J. B.|year=1983|publisher=National Center for Science Education}}</ref>
In this usage, the term is adopted descriptively rather than doctrinally. It reflects an externally applied label and is primarily used in polemical, historical, or comparative discussions. The term carries a confrontational or ironic tone due to its origins and is therefore not always preferred in neutral or internal contexts.
However we decided that it was not good and moved to Lifeism
=== Lifeism === '''Lifeism''' is a plain English descriptive term centered on ''life'' as the primary referent. It has a modern, minimalist tone and is used mainly for accessibility in English-language contexts.
The term does not imply a specific metaphysical position or hierarchy of life; rather, it functions as a broad label emphasizing continuity, vitality, and living processes. Because of its abstract and secular sound, it is often used where technical clarity or neutrality is desired.
=== Myōtō === 命道
'''Myōtō''' is a Sino-Japanese reading meaning “Way of Life.” The construction intentionally parallels ''Shintō'' (神道, “Way of the Gods”), replacing 神 (god) with 命 (life). This parallel exists at the level of linguistic form rather than institutional affiliation.
The term has a formal and slightly archaic tone, drawing on classical East Asian naming conventions. The reading ''Myōtō'' is preferred over alternatives that could suggest funerary, underworld, or death-related meanings. It is typically used where stylistic or cultural resonance with classical Japanese or Sinic traditions is desired.
=== Inochi-no-Michi === 命之道
'''Inochi-no-Michi''' is a native Japanese reading of the same characters, literally meaning “The Way of Life.” Compared to ''Myōtō'', this form has a softer, more explanatory tone and foregrounds semantic transparency.
The term emphasizes ''michi'' (道) as a path, practice, or orientation rather than as a named system. It is often used in interpretive, educational, or informal contexts, particularly when explaining the concept to a Japanese-speaking audience.
=== Inochi-no-Michikyō === 命道教
'''Inochi-no-Michikyō''' (“Teaching of the Way of Life”) explicitly frames the tradition as a religion through the addition of 教 (''kyō''). This form aligns with standard Japanese terminology for religious systems and sects.
The name is primarily used in classificatory, academic, or legal contexts where identification as a religion is required. Compared to ''Inochi-no-Michi'', it carries a more institutional and structured connotation.
=== Seimeikyo === (Chinese name)
In Chinese-language contexts, the tradition is referred to as '''生命教''' (“Religion of Life”). This abbreviated form follows common Chinese naming conventions for religions and avoids Japanese-specific readings.
The character 命 (''mìng'') carries multiple connotations in Chinese, including life, vitality, fate, and mandate, so it is not as clearly positive and life affirming as it is in Japanese. So changing it to 生命 helps make it clear that we are referring to life and not fatek
=== Translations and related renderings === Other descriptive translations are occasionally used for explanatory purposes, including:
* Latin: ''Via Vitae'' (“Way of Life”) * French: ''Voie de la Vie'' * German: ''Weg des Lebens'' * Spanish: ''Camino de la Vida''
These translations are not formal names but serve as interpretive equivalents when discussing the tradition in non–East Asian linguistic contexts.
=== Conceptual ordering of "life" in naming === Across languages, the names consistently place ''life'' (命) as the central referent, with variation occurring primarily in how it is framed:
* as a process (Lifeism), * as a general category (Lifeism), * as a path or way (道), * or as an institutional teaching (教).
The differences among the names reflect register, audience, and linguistic tradition rather than substantive disagreement.
== History == {{Main|Lifeism 1.0}} Lifeism may be seen as an offshoot of [[John Vervaeke|John Vervaeke's]] [[religion that's not a religion]] which adds a renewed focus on the [[Narrative Order|narrative order.]]
More info on the [[three orders]]<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20220425035243/https://www.reddit.com/r/DrJohnVervaeke/comments/kai0z1/could_anyone_help_in_clarifying_what_the/</ref>
Lifeism is currently in the stage of [[Lifeism 1.0]] which is primarily online, and will transition into [[Lifeism 2.0]] when infrastructure for it is possible. [[Category:Lifeism]] [[sn:Lifeism]][[Category:Religions]] [[sn:Lifeism]][[Category:Technoreligions]] [[Category:Images]] == Beliefs == Lifeism values agency and growth highly. It believes in a cosmic principle of [[alo]], sometimes called God, or God-Alo.
Lifeism sees life as being a puzzle, not a struggle, and that there is always an easy way out of a problem which is often ignored. As such Lifeism strives to avoid war and violence in favor of solving problems the easy way.
Lifeism believes that physical mortality is a substantial obstacle towards self actualization, and as such should be abolished, and that intelligence naturally subverts itself due to the [[nine plagues]]. Escaping this subverion must be done through puzzle solving, it cannot be done through brute force.
Lifeism focuses substantially on the [[Fermi paradox]] which is seen as the ultimate puzzle which will determine if life can survive.
=== The Man, Lion, and Beast === 👨🦁🐲
This is a group of three elements corresponding to parts of the human soul. See [[Plato's Lion]] for more info
Basically Lifeism believes people do not naturally have the agency to guide their lives in the way traditionally thought by capitalist society, but rather rely on other people, and that capitalism attempts to cover this up to make people more easily exploited
Fundamental to the [[Lambda covenant]] is the idea that the group guides the individual out of the [[nine plagues]]
== Symbol == {{Main|Alo}} [[File:Alo Nine.svg|thumb|The current [[symbol of Alo]]]]
Lifeism uses the [[Sierpiński triangle]] as its symbol representing a [[recursive]] application of [[Alo]] at all levels === Motto === The phrase [[as above, so below]] is often used as a motto of Lifeism to express the idea of a recursive spiritual philosophical system
==Practices== {{Main|Lifeism 2.0}} Lifeism follows a system of practices built around science and philosophy
=== Initiatory ethics === Ethics is seen as initiatory with gradual increases in obligations rather than something static. Initiaiton is generally seen as important with little expectations of non-initiatory practice
=== Marriage levels === {{Main|Syzygy}} Marriages are at three levels: [[Omega syzygy|omega]] [[Lambda syzygy|lambda]] and [[Alpha syzygy|alpha]] corresponding to someone's level of initiation. Coronation being Celestial initiation or [[Patriarchal priesthood|Patriarchal Priesthood]] initiation allows for celestial marriage
The basic notion behind this is to prevent divorce by enforcing a vetting process to ensure people have the will and resources to stay married. This ensures children can be more reliably born with good lives, and as such the population will increase
=== Covenants === There are three [[covenants]]. Someone must join one and then wait a certain period and meet certain criteria to join the next. They are seen as cosmologically important and reflective of the nature of the universe
# [[Omega covenant]] # [[Lambda covenant]] # [[Alpha covenant]]
=== Coronation === {{Main|Coronation}}
Coronation is moving to the Alpha Covenant. It is a massive system in itself
=== Sangha democracy === {{Main|Sangha Democracy}}
Sangha democracy is the notion of [[prides]] locally running themselves and determining their laws. Such will be in a system based on Athenian democracy. It has three main goals.
* Legitimization of firmlaw for individuals * Tailoring firmlaw to local areas * Raising up of the individual themselves by placing them in such debates.
==See also== * [[Political Lifeism]] * [[Extropianism]]
==References== <references /> [[Category:Pages]]
